thread.title: Ahead of Joaquin, Keystone Nationals, Hagan prepares for worst
thread.title_full: Ahead of Joaquin, Keystone Nationals, Hagan prepares for worst

title: Ahead of Joaquin, Keystone Nationals, Hagan prepares for worst
text:
Ahead of Joaquin, Keystone Nationals, Hagan prepares for worst 
Updated: 
Posted by: Jason Bristol 
HARRISBURG -- Hoping to win another world title, Funny Car driver Matt Hagan has another opponent to contend with: Hurricane Joaquin. 
Hagan resides in Virginia, where a state of emergency has already been issued ahead of this weekend's potentially dangerous weather. 
He has to be at Maple Grove Raceway, however, racing the NHRA's Keystone Nationals. 
He's already prepared his family, including his pregnant wife, for the worst. 
"You kiss your wife and kids on the head and tell them to hunker down and be safe," said Hagan in an interview Thursday with CBS 21 News Sports Director Jason Bristol. 
"I was up until one o'clock (in the morning) last night with ten gas cans -- filling those up -- and generators and hooking everything up just so I felt, in some way, (its) a littler safer for them; and that she's going to be O.K." 
Due to the inclement weather forecast Friday in the eastern Pennsylvania region, the NHRA has already moved up the starting times for the first two NHRA Mello Yello Series qualifying sessions on Friday, Oct. 2, of the NHRA Keystone Nationals at Maple Grove Raceway. The race, which will be televised on ESPN2, is the third of six playoff rounds in the NHRA Mello Yello Countdown to the Championship. 
The first round of Mello Yello Series qualifying will begin two hours earlier at 11:15 a.m. ET with Pro Stock Motorcycle, followed by Pro Stock at 11:30 a.m. Funny Car qualifying will begin at noon and Top Fuel qualifying will start at 12:30 p.m. 
The second session of pro qualifying is scheduled for 2:15 p.m. Pro Stock Motorcycle will be followed by Pro Stock at 2:30 p.m. The second round of Funny Car qualifying is scheduled to begin at 3 p.m. and Top Fuel is set to start at 3:30 p.m. 
The schedule for Saturday’s final two rounds of pro qualifying remains the same, at 11:15 a.m. and 2:45 p.m. Sunday’s eliminations begin at 11 a.m. 
Some information and video used in this story is provided by NHRA. Related Stories
